message:
Guys,

Are many people here using Resharper? I would like to know is it good and do you actually pay to get it?

Thanks

data.message: It's worthy.
Mohamed Gamal Eldin so what licence did you buy?
ReSharper C# Edition Commercial License. It's the License that my organization have.
ناس بتحبه أوي ـ وناس بتكرهه أوي ، لازم تجربه فترة طويلة ، مشروعين أو شهر عشان تاخد قرارك

you can download a trial for 30 days (And 30 more days on the EAP version, which isn't intended for daily use)... for me IntelliJ's PHPstorm has really been sooo fascinating for me that I all of a sudden decided to start using an IDE on what I used to call a "light interpreted language that needs nothing more than just a super fast editor" :D --NOT A C# guy here, but if their quality is similar to Android Studio, Webstorm and PHPstorm I'd directly recomend it to a friend :D --but yes again, use it for a month on a real project and you'll tell if u like it more than whatever u're currently using or not :)

EDIT: apparently they don't have a discount program for people using other (commercial) tools like they do with their PHP and Web versions because apparently anyone writing C# is probably using another commercial tool :D
It's a great tool, but very heavy on memory
any free alternatives???

free, NO. not even close to Resharper.
but one of the best free addons for visual studio is a one made by  
Mads Kristensen (Program manager at Microsoft) which should enhance your overall experience with VS.
It's called: Web Essential: http://vswebessentials.com/
God i hate the word "web"

I don't even consider web dev serious programming, I know I can get some fire here, but hell, what is the use of HTML tags and bloody data requests, what a boring application. This describes my main problem these days, I like backend stuff, but web pages is just too boring and mediocre

Mohamed El Sayed But thanks for answering the question, sorry about the rant, but I am trying to get to the bottom of why so much tech stuff has become absolutely boring to me, while new technologies seem like the sexiest thing right now :)

مالك بتكره أوي كده ؟ أنا عارف ليه :)  اتكلمنا كتير في الموضوع ده... بس  برضه بص له على أساس انه البلاستك الخارجي اللي بيقفل شغلك ... أو بدي العربية الخارجي بتاعك .... عايز تكره البدي بتاع العربية انت حر ، بس في ناس بتحب تفنن فيه
I get really borefd filling comboboxes and  making grids render correctly :)

I recommend waiting until VS 2015 gets released, because I've seen a lot of improvements in refactoring because of Roslyn, I heard that some of the new refactoring features are part of ReSharper (note: I never actually tried ReSharper), so it might not be worth its price for some people.

Mohamed Samy you are using a WebApp that use a Web technology to interact with us and ask questions, no Web no mobile apps no Web Apps as simple as that and please don't blame the web for a stupid Web technology
Emad Mokhtar Habib I am not making an absolute statement that they are bad, just that they are very boring to code
Did you try Django? I REALLY LIKE IT try you are pythonist now, give me your feedback.
Some guys became addicts (just like me :) )
I use it at work, and I have a personal license for years too
Mohammad Tayseer so what's your Python Editor?
Mine are PyCharm and Sublime
Pycharm and Eric and Emacs

Sublime 3 with SublimeJEDI, Djaneiro, Emmet, SidebarEnhancements, Modific, IPython with Qt shell, ipdb, django-debug-toolbar, werkzeug debugger.

PyCharm & PyDev are heaving & slow for my taste.
